intro: Lobelia shaferi var. nipensis, commonly known as the Nippon lobelia, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
